review_data.title: What a disappointment!
review_data.content: To think this venue was once one of the most anarchic and controversial venues in Europe is unimaginable today. Tastefully adorning the walls are some accomplished photographs of offensive slogans of the Dadaists (instead of being sprayed across the walls graffiti style) but it has...More

review_data.title: Cosy bar with a Lot of historical background
review_data.content: This bar is the birthplace of the famous dadaism. But nowadays it's more and more just a bar. The drinks are priced at the usual zurich-level, the bar works properly and is pretty fast in distributing the orders, the back used to be very dark...More

review_data.title: Brilliant time!
review_data.content: Wasn’t sure what to expect because of some mixed reviews but we had a fantastic time. Benjamin was fabulous for not only making great discussion on culture, history and philosophy, he was also helpful on educating us on Dada. Very fitting to have such great...More

review_data.title: Absinthe the way it’s meant to be!
review_data.content: 2nd level bar with accommodating bar tender. It’s where the cool kids go in the heart of the art area..cobblestone street on foot. Great knowledge of absinthe with excellent selection.

review_data.title: Totally fun place!

review_data.title: behemian

review_data.title: One of the best alternative places in Zurich
review_data.content: Cabaret Voltaire is one of my favorite places in Zurich. Birthplace of Dadaism, this 98 year-old cafe still is one of the best places for students and artists. Weekly events, including free movie night (which also includes free pop corn), and many special occasions (talks...More
